mainnet:

0000000000000000003b9ce759c2a087d52abc4266f8f4ebd6d768b89defa50a was height 477890 and chainwork 000000000000000000000000000000000000000000723d3581fe1bd55373540a when the tip was 0000000000000000002ce179a3ad433a7d2e56769cf926a7a754580753262f70 with height 478890

-----BEGIN PGP SIGNATURE-----
Version: GnuPG
This chainwork does not match the chainwork for the assumevalid block below.
Well the current testnet chainwork on my node is higher than that, so I guess it doesn't really matter.

It didn't before either. nMinimum is set at the the tip, but for testnet assume valid was set 20k blocks back due to reorgs. The reason for the difference is because even in a reorg the tip will be at or equal the minimum work, but it may not contain the old tip block.

Another possibility potentially less confusing for review it's also going back 20k blocks for the nMinimumChainWork to match the chain work of the chosen defaultAssumeValid.\nAs explained to me [last time](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/9779#issuecomment-280536291) they don't need to match, but perhaps someone different will ask the same question on each major release and the gain of the
